title: Creating Campaign - Successfully create a txt2security campaign
custom_preconds: Given you are logged into campaign manager with a user that has permission to create a txt2security campaign
custom_steps:
When you log into campaign manager
And click on the 'New Campaign' button
And click on 'txt2security' in drop down
And fill out form correctly
And click 'create'
custom_expected: Then you will be brought to the campaign page of the newly created campaign

title: Creating Campaign - Attempt to create campaign with keyword field blank
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And the user has permission to create a txt2security campaign
custom_steps:
When you are logged into campaign manager
And click on the 'New Campaign' button
And click on the txt2security link
And enter a campaign name
And leave 'keyword' blank
And click create
custom_expected: Then there should be an error in red next to keyword field

title: Creating Campaign - Verify help links
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the rights to create a txt2security campaign
And the user is on the 'New txt2security Campaign' page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the help links next to each field
custom_expected: Then there will be a pop up notification with information relevant to the field the link is next to

title: Creating Campaign - Verify character count
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the rights to create txt2security campaign
And the user is new txt2security campaign page
custom_steps:
When you begin typing in the following fields:

Max Texts Exceeded SMS MT
Response SMS MT
custom_expected: Then the character count are updated accordingly

title: Editing Campaign - Edit keyword
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And that user has access to txt2security page
And there is a txt2security campaign already created
custom_steps:
When you log into campaign manager
And click on the txt2security campaign
And click on edit button
And update the keyword
And click update
custom_expected:
Then you will be brought back to the campaign page
And the keyword should reflect the changes you have just made

title: Starting Campaign - Start campaign from all campaign page
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign either in a created or stopped state
And the user is on the All Campaigns page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the created or stopped button in the action column
And taps on ok button on the confirmation popup
And taps close
custom_expected:
Then the All Campaigns page will reload
And in the action column for that campaign the button will say Running
And the campaign will be filtered with the to the top with the other running campaigns
And the Last Run date will update to the current date and time
And the the row's text will turn green

title: Starting Campaign - Starting campaign from campaign page
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign created
And that campaign is either in the created or stopped state
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps not the start button
And taps on the ok button on the confirmation page
And taps on click here
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the campaign page
And the start button will gone
And there will be a stop button
And there will be no edit button
And in campaign run summary section there will be a new row
And the end date for that row will be 'Running[view]'

title: Testing Campaign - Sent text to txt2security campaign
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And have access to txt2security page
custom_steps:
When you send a text from a phone to the keyword of a txt2security campaign
And log into campaign manager
And click on the the txt2security campaign of the keyword you sent
And click on 'inbox'
custom_expected: Then you should see your text in the open and all filters

title: Testing Campaign - Testing updated keyword
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And that user has access to txt2security page
And there is already a txt2secuirty campaign created
custom_steps:
When you log into campaign manager
And update the keyword of a txt2security campaign
And send a text to the new keyword
custom_expected: Then when you go into the inbox of the campaign you will see your text

title: Testing Campaign - Resolving an issue
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And the user has access to txt2security page
And there is already a txt2secuirty campaign created
And there is already a text in open issues filter of that campaign
custom_steps:
When you log into campaign manager
And click on the txt2security campaign
And click on inbox
And click on the radio button next to the issue you wish to resolve
And click the resolve button
custom_expected:
Then that issue will be removed from the open filter
And appear in the resolved filter

title: Testing Campaign - Sending Response MT
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And the user has access to txt2security page
And there is already a txt2secuirty campaign created
And there is already a text in open issues filter of that campaign
And the user is on the Inbox for that campaing
custom_steps:
When the user taps on any of the messages
And enters text in the message box
And taps update
And taps on close window on the confirm page
custom_expected:
Then the user who sent the message will receive the MT
And the Msg column will update the number
And when the number is tapped it will display all the messages

title: Testing Campaign - Verifying Refresh on the inbox is working
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And the user has access to txt2security page
And there is already a txt2secuirty campaign created
And there is already a text in open issues filter of that campaign
And the user is on the Inbox page of that campaign
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the 'Turn On Refresh' link in the top right
And the user sends a message into the campaign
custom_expected: Then the user will see the new message show up

title: Testing Campaign - Updating status of a message
custom_preconds:
Given there is an active txt2security campaign
And there are messages in the inbox
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the inbox link
And taps on one of the messages
And taps on the status drop down menu
And selects one of the options
And taps the update button
And taps on the close window on the confirmation page
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought back to the inbox on the all messages tab
And the status of the message should be updated
And if the user taps on the status tab at the top they will see the message in that tab

title: Testing Campaign - Add Carrier Specific Bouncebacks
custom_preconds:
Given there is an txt2security campaign
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the 'Add Carrier Specific Bouncebacks' link
And the user taps on the 'Add New Response' radio button
And the user taps on the keyword drop down 
And selects one of the options
And taps on the carrier drop down menu
And selects one of the options
And fils in the Response Message
And taps on the save button
custom_expected:
Then the user will be returned to the bounce back page
And the user will see the new row for the newly created message

title: Testing Campaign - Send text with '@' symbol in it
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign created
And that campaign has been started
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user sends a text with an '@' to the short code
And taps the inbox
custom_expected: Then the user will see the text they just sent in

title: Testing Campaign - Testing max texts per user - campaign run
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the ability to create a txt2security campaign
And there is a txt2security campaign
And that campaign has a max texts limit set
custom_steps:
When the user sends a text to the short code and keyword of the txt2security campaign
And repeats sending a text to the short code and keyword until they hit the max limit
And the user will receive the max text exceeded sms MT
And every time the user sends a text to the short code while the campaign is running
custom_expected: Then the user will receive the max text exceeded sms MT

title: Testing Campaign - Testing max texts per user - day
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the ability to create a txt2screen campaign
And there is a txt2screen campaign
And that campaign has a max texts limit set
custom_steps:
When the user sends a text to the short code of the txt2security campaign
And repeats sending a text to the short code until they hit the max limit
And the user will receive the max text exceeded sms MT
And when the user waits till the next day
And sends another text to the short code
custom_expected: Then the user will receive the normal response and NOT the exceeded sms MT

title: Testing Campaign - Max text campaign user sends text with new campaign run
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign running
And there is a max text limit set
And there is a user that has hit this limit
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps the stop button
And taps the start button
And the user sends a text to the short code and keyword
custom_expected: Then the user will receive the "Confirm MT message for text" MT

title: Testing Campaign - Send help text
custom_preconds: Given there is a running txt2security campaign
custom_steps: When the user sends keyword and 'help' to the short code
custom_expected: Then the user will receive the help mt

title: Testing Campaign - Getting error text
custom_preconds: Given there is a running txt2security campaign
custom_steps: When the user sends in a keyword and text to the short code that does not match anything
custom_expected: Then the user will receive the error mt

title: Cloning Campaign - Clone a txt2security campaign
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And the user has access to txt2security page
And there is already a txt2secuirty campaign created
And the user is on the txt2security campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the green 'Clone' button in the top left
And update the 'Campaign Name'
And update the keyword
And taps on the 'Create' button
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the campaign page of the new txt2security campaign

title: Cloning Campaign - Verify help links
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign created
And that that campaign has never been started
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the clone button
custom_expected: Then all the help links should have relative information to the field they are next to

title: Cloning Campaign - Verify character count
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign
And it has never been started
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the clone button
And enters characters into the following fields:

Max Texts Exceeded SMS MT
Response SMS MT
custom_expected: Then the character count should update accordingly

title: Stopping Campaign - Stopping campaign from all campaigns page
custom_preconds:
Given you are logged into campaign manager
And the user has access to txt2security page
And there is already a txt2secuirty campaign created
And the campaign is 'Running'
And the user is on the All Campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the 'Running' button in the Action column
And taps on the 'Ok' on the confirm page
And taps on the close button
custom_expected: Then that 'Running' should now be a red 'Stopped' button

title: Stopping Campaign - Stop a campaign from the campaign page
custom_preconds:
Given there is a running txt2security campaign
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the stop button
And the user taps on the ok button on the confirmation page
And the user taps on the click here button
custom_expected:
Then the user is taken back to the campaign page
And there is a green start button instead of a red stop button
And the top row of Campaign run summary has an end date of today

title: Expiring Campaign - Expire a txt2security campaign - active campaign
custom_preconds:
Given there is a txt2security campaign that is running
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the expire button
custom_expected:
Then the user will come to an error page that says:

"This campaign is currently running and cannot be expired."

title: Expiring Campaign - Expire a txt2security campaign - stopped campaign
custom_preconds:
Given there is a stopped txt2security campaign
And the user is on the campaign page
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the expire button
And taps on the ok button on the confirmation page
And taps on the 'click here to return home'
custom_expected:
Then the user will be returned to the all campaign page
And the expired campaign will not be there by default because expired campaigns are hidden by default
